fields.value: Behavioral Tracking Survey (FSW & High risk MSM) - 2010 (By HLFPPT)

authorName.value: Hindustan Latex Family Planning Promotion Trust

dsDescriptionValue.value: The objectives of the Behavioural Tracking Survey (BTS) were (1) To measure the major outcomes and impacts of the interventions funded by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation (BMGF) under the Avahan India AIDS Initiative by collecting behavioral trend data in populations targeted by the interventions. (2) To understand the relationship between community mobilization and service indicator outcomes such as promotion of condom use, reduction in violence and improved service utilization. This survey was conducted in the three districts (Krishna, Vijayanagaram, Srikakulam) of Andhra Pradesh for FSW population, while it covered only two districts  (Krishna and West Godavari) for High risk MSM population.

keywordValue.value: Advocacy, Behavioral tracking surveys with FSWs, Behavioral tracking surveys with MSM, Community mobilization, Community mobilization monitoring research (Avahan-CMMR), FSWs, High risk MSM, HIV, Sexual behavior ; INSTITUTION: HLFPPT; STRATEGIC AREA: FSWs, High risk MSM

producerName.value: Hindustan Latex Family Planning Promotion Trust

fields.value: Behavioral Tracking Survey (BTS-2010) was conducted among FSWs and High risk MSM to monitor the key components of the HIV prevention programme: safer sex behaviour, STI treatment seeking behaviours and community mobilisation. It was conducted in 4 coastal districts (Krishna, West Godavari, Srikakulam and Vizianagaram) of Andhra Pradesh.  The study involved two stages viz., rapid remapping exercise followed by the sampling and quantitative survey. Probability Proportional to Size (PPS) sampling method was adopted for selection of different clusters. With in different clusters a total of 1989 samples were collected (1189 FSWs and 800 High risk MSMs) in different districts of AP,  Krisna and West Godavari districts both with 400 samples were selected for conducting the High risk MSM data collection, while Krishna, Vizianagaram, Srikakulam  districts were selcted for FSW data collection. The eligible Female Sex Workers (FSW) taken in the study were females aged 18 years or older, either brothel or street or lodge or home based, who sold sex in exchange for cash at least once in the past one month. Whereas Men who have Sex with other Men (High risk MSM) were taken from men aged 18 years or older, who had sex (oral/manual/anal) with other men at least once in the past one month.
